Growing Notes: Burry the seed to prevent mold from occurring. Must be kept in the dark for the entirety of the grow to prevent from turning green.
Sunflower is very prone to mold. When soaking the seed, use a mix of H2O2. We germinate a day longer to allow the weight to assist in knocking off that hull.
Burry the seed to keep the hull from being brought up into the canopy. Weight also helps to keep the coco coir from lifting into the crop.
Use as little water as possible to prevent mold. Possible to keep growing after first cut, however noticeable imperfection will exist. Second cut good for juicing.
Burry the seed to keep the hull from being brought up into the canopy. Weight also helps to keep the coco coir from lifting up into the crop.
Burying the seed and keeping weight on is extremely important to keep the hull from being brought up into the canopy.
Prone to mold on top of the medium. Keep H2O2 mix ready to keep control of the mold. Can continue to be grown after first harvest for a second and third time.
You can harvest this as early as Day 14, however if you wait this crop out, it does get much larger. Some like to wait until Day 28 to harvest!

After several tests, we found it is beneficial to keep weight on basil. It really helps to drive down the roots. Be sure not to life the tray during germination due to the seeds being mucilaginous.
They will stop sticking around Day 5.

Must mist this everyday in germination.
We found that covering the seeds with a thin layer of soil on top, helps to shed the hull off the crop.
